advocate.title: Save Ethnic Studies in California!
advocate.subtitle: We, the students of California, are asking the Senate appropriations committee to move AB-331 to the Senate floor so that an Ethnic Studies course becomes a graduation requirement at all California public and charter schools.

advocate.title: Email the CA Senate Appropriations Committee
advocate.subtitle: Send an email to members of the California Senate Appropriations Committee to express your support for AB-331, which mandates Ethnic Studies as a graduation requirement at CA high schools.

emailInfo.subject: I Support AB-331
emailInfo.messageBody:
Dear Senate Appropriations Committee members,

My name is [Your name], and I am [student, former student, parent, educator, etc.] from [Your location]. I’m emailing to express my support for AB 331, which would make ethnic studies a high school graduation requirement. [Sentence about why ethnic studies is important to you.] I’m asking Senator Portantino to move the bill out of the Senate Appropriations Committee and allow it to move forward for a vote.

Thank you,
[Your name]
